story:
Short Summary

The ChiNOLA Connection is a group of students, teachers, and parents of diverse backgrounds from across the toughest neighborhoods of Chicago. Originally, we joined the many people who volunteered to help rebuild New Orleans after the Katrina floods.  We continue to go because the government has failed the poorest people of New Orleans.  But we have not forgotten them! We go because we have made friends and relationships of mutual support. We go to resist this injustice of historic proportions.
Our project is to heal the divisions in Chicago, too.  Students from Kelly, Social Justice, Gage Park, and Julian high schools have joined together forming lasting relationships that benefit our social justice work in Chicago.  Our activist students have enlivened student groups including Chicago Students Organized to Save Our Schools, Mikva Challenge, and Chicago Youth Initiating Change.
Student responsibility and leadership is emphasized. This intense week of experiential learning through service, interaction with activist students and adults, and self-reliance has changed the lives of many young people. Exponential growth is a frequent outcome.

What We Need & What You Get

This is a shoestring operation.  Cost per participant is $325.  Students are actively engaged in fund raising activities but many do not have the additional financial resources from home to make their goal.

We do everything we can to reduce costs: We rent vans and drive 18 hours to New Orleans ($2100 per van).  We sleep on the floor of a church ($60 per person).  We cook our own meals ($70 per person).  We have additional expenses of admission fees, insurance, and incidentals.

Your reward is to be a part of changing the lives of students from Chicago while aiding the ongoing struggle to save the poorest communities of New Orleans.  

The Impact

Many students from the west and south sides of Chicago never get the chance to explore other neighborhoods in Chicago, let alone all that other beautiful cities have to offer.  This opportunity to do service learning in New Orleans not only gives students a chance to get out of Chicago for their spring break, but also allows them to truly earn their seat on the bus by having organized with students across the city around issues of public education, gentrification, community violence, and fair trade. Students also study grant writing to secure funding from various philanthropic institutions. In New Orleans, we rehabilitate houses and learn about communities devastated by Hurricane Katrina. We have specifically chosen to focus on historically neglected communities still not adequately supported to rebuild some 9 years later. Your contribution helps make all this possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word about our group!  Not enough is heard in the media about all the positive contributions of Chicago's youth, so tell the world yourself!  Let everyone know about our students' efforts to collaborate with youth across the city and in New Orleans in order to become agents of change in a society of many injustices.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Kim Weyer but the children refer to me as - Ms Kim.  It has been my honor and pleasure to have spent the last 20 years teaching 3,4 and 5 year old children at St Thomas Preschool.   I am blessed to be a part of their early childhood education and strive to make it the best experience possible!  The children of today are our future...so consider this an investment in our future!!!

A few years ago,  I was given some pieces of the Learning with the Letter People Program from another school... and it has been a huge success in preschool.  The children really enjoy meeting the different Letter People.  Our issue is that the Letter People are inflatables and most of them leak so they lose their shape before the lesson ends =-(  I have been looking online for replacements but have had no luck since this program is from the 1990's.  My wish is to upgrade to the new/more current Letter People Program!!!

Introductory Program includes:

26 Letter People Hand Puppets

The Complete Teacher’s Resource File (Blueprint, 5 Teacher Resource Books, Assessments Booklet, Health & Safety Mini Story Cards, Ready to Read Rebus Pictures, Teacher Resources CD)

Profiles of the Letter People

Letter People Meeting & Greeting Cards (30 each of 26 cards)

Let’s Sing with the Letter People CD (26 songs for Pre-K)

10 Letter People Big Books and 3 each of matching Student Editions

Letter People Read-Along CD (27 audio books)

Letter People Virtual Books

Thank you in advance for any and all assistance in helping us reach our goal!!!

story:
Sigue en Español

My dream has been to create a Latino cultural space for all in NYC !

I invite you to help La Sirena Mexican Folk Art grow into La Sirena Cultural Space, a place where everyone can discover and share the beauty of Latino folk art and culture !!

A folk art shop representing artists and artisans from Mexico, NYC and beyond!

Talks, workshops and demonstrations on folk art, indigenous culture, music, spiritual and social issues.

A gallery space, art class and cultural workshops/ demonstrations given by people here in NYC and beyond.

Cooking classes and language exchange.

Yes, there are many amazing artesanos right here en NYC not even knowing people would love to see them demonstrate, create, display and sell their work, we will invite them.NYC and beyond.

A llibrary where we can exchange books and videos.

A garden with hammocks, flowers, tomatillos, people and more.

A snack shack where revolving abuelitos (little grandparents) could sell tamales and other traditional Latin American foods

By raising the rent in our current space 35%, the universe is calling me to make my dream a reality now. (see article: http://eastvillage.thelocal.nytimes.com/2012/07/23/its-official-42-percent-rike-hike-sends-la-sirena-into-limbo/). I have been saving for this moment, but New York City is expensive and La Sirena cultural space needs some help to get things going.

THANK YOU !

To all the wonderful artesanos who make La Sirena possible!

Lila Downs for sharing her music for the video !

Sam Collins for donating and co-creating the video with Mike Rosado !

All our great customers who helped make La Sirena possible for so many years !

Gracias a la vida !  Thank you for life !

WAYS YOU CAN HELP

You can pass this fund raising effort on to others. Spreading the word is great! 

You can donate and get a gift, pick a great perk and an amount that works for you!

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

Fund-raising

I have some funds set aside to grow, but opening a space in New York is an expensive project and I need your help to make La Sirena Cultural Space a reality.Any extra monies raised will go towards classes and scholarships.

Space selection

I am working with the universal energies and realtors to select a great location !

Build-out

Once we secure a location, we will invite the community to help. If you like, you can volunteer with what is needed to open or just enjoy our grand opening fiesta ! 

Move

Moving is always exciting and challenging, we invite you to join this effort as well. 

Launch

Once we are ready, we will let everyone know we are here and will invite you to join our fiesta, celebration !

Hope we do and if we do not make our goal

If we do not make enough for the cultural space as listed, will use money for a folk art shop and cultural events and yes a fun filled fiesta in the new year !!
Grateful for friends and the La Sirena creative, cultural community !

A look into La Sirena and Dina Leor, by Amaris Castillo

http://thisisfusion.tumblr.com/post/31468134833/la-sirena-living-altar-mexico-nyc

 

***

Mi sueño ha sido crear un espacio cultural latino para todos en Nueva York.

Te invito a soñar con migo y ayudar a La Sirena, artesanía Mexicana/Latina en obtener nuestro espacio cultural: un lugar donde todo el mundo puede descubrir y compartir la belleza del arte y la cultura latina.

Una tienda de arte folclorico que representa a los artistas y
artesanos de México, Nueva York y más allá!

Un espacio de la galería, clases de arte y talleres culturales/demostraciones presentada  por la cultura rica y gente creativa aquí en Nueva York y más allá.

Sí, hay muchos artesanos talentosos aquí en Nueva York! Los invitamos a ellos que les encantarían hacer demuestras, crear, mostrar y vender su creaciones.

Intercambio de talleres y demostraciones de arte popular, cultura
indígena, música, talleres espirituales y sociales, clases de cocina y inter cambio de
idioma.

Una biblioteca donde podríamos intercambiar libros y videos. Un jardín con hamacas, flores, tomatillos, personas y mucho más.

Una palapita de comida donde abuelitos/abuelitas podrían vender tamales y
otras comiditas tradicionales.

Al elevar la renta en nuestro espacio actual por 35%, el universo me
está llamando para hacer mi sueño una realidad ahora.

He estado ahorrando para este momento, pero Nueva York es caro y el
espacio cultural de La Sirena necesita un poco de apoyo para que el espacio
cultural se hagan realidad.

¡GRACIAS!

Para todos los maravillosos artesanos que hacen a La Sirena
posible!

Lila Downs para compartir su música para el video!

Sam Collins por donar y co- crear el vídeo con Mike Rosado!

Todos nuestros gran clientes que ayudaron a hacer a La Sirena posible durante tantos años !

Gracias a la vida!

FORMAS DE AYUDAR:

Si usted puede pasar este esfuerzo de recaudación de fondos a otras personas: Compartir el mensaje es es un apoyo grande !

Usted puede donar y obtener un regalo: tomar un gran beneficio y podrá donar una cantidad que funcione para usted ! Todas las donaciones ayudan !

RIESGOS Y DESAFIOS

Recolección de fondos: Tengo algunos fondos destinados a crear el espacio, pero para tener
un espacio en Nueva York es un proyecto caro y necesito tu ayuda para hacer el
espacio de La Sirena realidad. Cualquier dinero extra recaudado será destinado a
las clases y becas.

Selección del espacio: Estoy trabajando con las energías universales y corredores de bienes
raíces para seleccionar una ubicación estupenda!

Construcción:Una vez que nos aseguramos del lugar, vamos a invitar a la comunidad
para ayudar. Si lo desea, usted puede ayudar con lo que se necesita para abrir o
simplemente disfrutar de nuestra fiesta de inauguración!

Mudanza:Una vez listos, vamos a dejar que todo el mundo sepa que estamos aquí
y vamos a invitar a que se unan a nuestra fiesta de celebración!

Una mirada a La Sirena y Dina Leor, por Amaris Castillo.

http://thisisfusion.tumblr.com/post/31468134833/la-sirena-living-altar-mexico-nyc

Josey Cruz y participantes en taller de flores, evento cultural de Dia de los Muertos !!

story:
Oh the Places We Will Go...

We are team Two and A Half Men and A Woman and we are going to be participating in a charity event called Jailbreak for our university. We are raising money for the Student Volunteering Cardiff (SVC for short) which participates in community events including but not limited to dog walking, beach cleaning, and elderly socials. 

The goal is: 

Get as far as is humanely possible from Cardiff AND back within 54 hours. This can include trains, planes and automobiles, not to mention bikes or literally any other form of transportation we may be able to find. 

Piece of cake right? Here's the catch:

We have to do it only on money that we raise throughout the campaign. Here's where you lovely people come in. 

The more that is donated to our event, the farther we can travel, bringing our ridiculous attitude, signs and guitars to distant lands loudly busking for money for our charity, the more likely we are to come across more charitable people like yourselves :)

Any money left over from this specific account as well as everything we raise on the way will all go towards the SVC. 

Even if you can't donate, please tell your friends and whatnot as well as sharing liking and tweeting this if you can. The Indeigogo share tools work as well!

Our Facebook page can be found at:

https://www.facebook.com/twoandahalfmenandawoman

Thank you very much for your help!

Two and a Half Men and a Woman

story:
Why is 102.7 The Hog Here?

In our community there are children who cant attend preschool simply because they don't qualify for transportation. There are at risk teens, home alone after school. 102.7 The Hog would like to help change that.

102.7 The Hog is a non profit radio station. Our goal is to assist local early childhood education and teen mentoring programs. We want to help get children transportation to school and help those schools and teachers with giving our youngest children the best education possible. We want to work with teen outreach and mentoring programs to help these young people make good decisions.

But to do this, we need to get on the air. With an FM signal, we can attract more programing underwriters and show sponsors. This means revenue that we can use to assist and promote these local programs.  


Why Part 2?

As the name implies, this is the second round of our fundraising drive. The First Round got us closer to our funding goal and we want to thank the folks who donated. We raised just enough to buy 1 of the 2 antennas we'll need. We hope in this campaign to raise the rest of what we need to get on the air

Why $5,000?

In our First Round, we set a funding goal that would have covered all the equipment we would have liked to have had. In this round, we're asking for just whats needed to get on the air. That means a transmitter, an Emergency Broadcast unit and 1 more antenna. Combined with what we received in the first round, this should get us close to having everything we need to get on the air.

We Want to Give You a Little Something for Your Help


$5 Piglet Donator -
A big virtual High Five, our everlasting Thanks and your name on the contributor page of our website.

$10 Road Hog Donator -

An official 102.7 The Hog Bumper Sticker. Let everyone know you listen to The Hog when you’re on the road. Plus your name on the contributor page of our website.

$25 Piggy Donator -

What could be cooler than your own 102.7 The Hog, Hog. This groovy squeeze toy sports some cool shades and the 102.7 The Hog logo. This is one cool Rock Pig. You also get the official 102.7 The Hog Bumper Sticker and your name on the contributor page.
$50 Corn Hog Donator -

Made specially for 102.7 The Hog by BobKorn Kettle Korn, enjoy a big bag of Bacon Flavored Popcorn. You also get the 102.7 Rock Pig Toy, the official 102.7 The Hog Bumper Sticker and your name on the contributors page.
Note: If you aren’t feeling the Bacon Flavored Popcorn, we will substitute for Sweet Butter instead.

$100 Hog Jock Donator (limit 50) -

Here’s an opportunity for you to pick the music we play. At this level, you will get to select the tracks for a 1 hour Mixtape that will be stored at the 102.7 The Hog studios and played on air, giving you credit for for the music selection. You will also get the Popcorn, Rock Pig Toy, Bumper Sticker and your name on the contributor page.

$250 Big Pig Donator -

There isn’t much that would be cooler than wearing your very own 102.7 The Hog T-Shirt. Emblazoned with the 102.7 The Hog logo on the back this XL shirt comes in any color you want, as long as it’s black. You also get to create the 1 hour Mixtape stored at the 102.7 studios, the Bacon Popcorn, the Rock Pig Toy, the Bumper Sticker and your name on the contributors page.

$500 Hog Wild Donator -


Here is the one thing cooler than a 102.7 The Hog T-shirt, a 102.7 The Hog Hoodie. Sporting the 102.7 The Hog logo on the back, you will be the envy of every Rocker around. You will also get the Hog T-shirt, the Mixtape, the Popcorn, The Rock Pig Toy, the Bumper Sticker and your name on the contributors page.

$1,000 Whole Hog Donator (Limit 3) -

For those who go all in with their support of 102.7 The Hog, we have this very cool poker set. The solid wood box sports a metal plate with The Hog logo and has everything you need for a night of poker, including professional grade chips. Plus, you get The Hog Hoodie, the Hog T-shirt, the 1 hour Mixtape, the Bacon Popcorn, the Rock Pig Toy, The Hog Bumper Sticker and your name on the contributors page.


Other ways to Help Get The Hog On The Air

Help us spread the word about The Hog and our fundraiser. Share us on facebook, twitter and everywhere else on the net. Follow us and get updates to our campaign then share our news with others. If you have other ideas of how to promote this campaign, please leave a comment.

also get to create the 1 hour Mixtape stored at the 102.7 studios, the

 is the one thing cooler than a 102.7 The Hog T-shirt, a 102.7 The Hog

Mixtape, the Popcorn, The Rock Pig Toy, the Bumper Sticker and your name

professional grade chips. Plus, you get The Hog Hoodie, the Hog T-shirt,

If you have other ideas of how to promote this campaign, please leave a comment.

story:
A Little About Us

Hey World,

We are the students and staff of ParaDYM Academy, a digital youth media  program that combines transmedia production, media literacy and game design to promote youth voice, academic achievement and workforce readiness.  Since 2008 more than 100 at-risk students in Central and Southern Connecticut have enrolled in ParaDYM workshops, live interactive events, after-school and summer programs.

Our students have not only created music, videos and taken photos for school assignments, they have also created media for community organizations like OIC of New Britain, The Boys and Girls Clubs of Connecticut, Central Connecticut State University and even the City of New Britain.  Unfortunately, although our students have been able to reach new heights in their expression and have had a transformative effect on their communities, they do not have a safe space dedicated to their creation of digital media.

Your contribution will help give ParaDYM Academy students a home to call their own- a studio space designed to promote youth voice and community engagement through digital youth media.  Set-up Downtown New Britain in Central Connecticut State University's Institute of Technology and Business Development and just walking distance from the new CTfastrak, a new express bus service that connects New Britain with the state capital, Hartford, CT, the new ParaDYM studio will serve as safe, secure home base for our students and provide them with continued access to the equipment and core competencies they will need to actively compete in the 21st Century.

ParaDYM Inc is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non‐profit arts service organization.  Fractured Atlas will receive grants for the charitable purposes of ParaDYM Inc, provide oversight to ensure that grant funds are used in accordance with grant agreements, and provide reports as required by he grantor. Contributions for the charitable purposes of ParaDYM Inc must be made payable to Fractured Atlas and are tax‐deductible to the extent permitted by law.


What We Need & What You Get

So we're asking for $20,000 to complete our studio project.  The priority is securing the site, so in the event we fall short of our goal, your funds will be used to fund the following in order of importance:

  • $9,000 will be used to pay rent and utilities.
  • $4,000 for furniture
  • $7,000 in computer equipment

The Impact

ParaDYM Academy has worked with at-risk and marginalized students throughout Central and Southern Connecticut, but our primary focus is the city of New Britain, which is plagued by poverty and an over-taxed school system that is ill equipped to prepare many of its most promising students a chance at a better future.  With 26% of students below the age of 18 living below the poverty line, a matriculation rate that hovers around %50, a juvenile detention rate at the high school twice the state average at %6 and the fifth largest percentile of the prison population, New Britain is a city where opportunity and achievement seem rare and often unattainable your its young citizens.

ParaDYM Academy has worked alongside  students, many of whom had already been written off by authority figures their communities, like teachers and other program administrators, simply because they under preformed academically or they seemed to lack focus.   The majority of our 8th grade students have said no one has ever spoken to them about the possibilities of attaining a degree, even though Central Connecticut State University (CCSU) is within walking distance of Downtown New Britain, and many have been ridiculed for even having such aspirations even by members of their own families.

This is why youth voice initiatives are important in general, and why ParaDYM Academy is specifically ideal for at-risk students.  We not only allow them to explore the power of their voice for self-exploration and as young citizens, thanks to our continued partnership with CCSU and the New Britain Unified School District, we create a pathway that bridges the achievement gap and digital divide that so far has brought over 100 at-risk and marginalized students form the background to the forefront of 21st Century skill development and youth voice.

    Risks & Challenges

    The two major obstacles we face in aiding our students along their journey of self-discovery and future development are parental engagement and not having a dedicated space for them to call their own. 

    Although our students are excited about the opportunities that arise out of their participation in ParaDYM projects, they still need their parents support for simple things like active participation, transportation to the program and other location sites and outside food costs. We have reached out to CCSU and they are providing grad interns to help make it easier for us to connect with parents and keep in touch with them about any barriers that may be blocking them from fully engaging with their children while they are participating in ParaDYM programs.  We find that students whose parents are even just more likely to stop by and see what we are doing tend to explore more options and actively assume leadership roles within the Academy experience.

    Secondly, having a home base would allow us to provide a safe secure space for self-exploration, expression and production.  Although we are grateful for all off the assistance we have been able to receive from the organizations which have housed us in the past, we have had to deal with security issues and work around the schedules of our partnering organizations.  this has lead to damage and theft of equipment and reduced our ability to serve our students.  The creation of our digital arts space/studio will cater to the needs of our students in a safe, secure environment dedicated to the creation of digital youth media as well as college prep and workforce development.

    Here Are Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help, spread the word about the great work our students do and about the studio we'd like to build for them.

story:
My Story

My name is Laith Abu Zeyad, I am 23 years old and living in Palestine. I am prospective postgraduate student. I have recently graduated from Al-Quds Bard Honors College, where I was awarded a first-class honors degree in International Law and Human Rights. I have known in my heart since I was a little boy what I wanted to be when I grew up. It was not a stereotypical child’s dream such as a doctor or an astronaut; my vision was instead something that has shaped my actions and decisions throughout my life. In the last few years I have realized that my passion for human rights is a natural calling that I am destined to follow.  I have striven for academic excellence, always wishing to make the most of my education. Having completed my undergraduate degree, I am now keen to continue my studies. I would like to further specialize in the Human Rights field, with the ultimate intention of helping implement, promote and protect human rights laws in Palestine.  This Master’s program will add a practical experience to my academic experience that I already have. The most important thing is to enjoy mutually rewarding, co-operative working relationships with students from all over the world, to work together effectively and positively, and enjoys the happy. I am interested in a new challenge and an opportunity to use my academic skills and experiences in a different capacity. Education has always been an important aspect of my life. 

Although, education plays a significant role in my life, I am involved with many other activities. During high school I was an active member of several clubs. I enjoyed helping others with schoolwork and have continued to help them at the college level. I have worked on a summer research project at Al-Quds Human Rights Clinic, and I have done an internship at the Heart Mountain Interpretive Learning Center in the United States. I have also done community work in Palestine and during my time in the United States, such as planted gardens, cleaned up streets, coat sale at the Methodist Church, and a special after school reading program for the Big Brother Big Sister Organization in the United States. All of these experiences have helped to shape me.

Having been born in the Occupied Palestinian Territories, my rights have been violated a lot. I have been born into one of the most complicated and protracted conflicts in the world, encompassing 60 years of conflict and 42 years of military occupation. I come from a middle class Palestinian family, thus I do not receive any financial support from my family or government to fund my college education. Therefore my financial needs are very high. 

Recently, I have been offered a full scholarship to read for my master's degree in Human Rights at the London School of Economics and Political Science in the UK. The main reason I want to go on this journey is because of the excellent program offered in that specialization. I have striven for academic excellence, always wishing to make the most of my education. So, I believe that this opportunity will enable me to fulfill my desire to expand my knowledge, and to help others. 

Unfortunately, I cannot currently afford to pay my own way through a postgraduate course. Despite being the recipient of a scholarship from the LSE, the combined cost of tuition fees and living expenses is simply unworkable. The LSE is generously covering my academic fees, but the challenge now is to secure funding for my living expenses in London. 

The Impact
I do believe that young leaders make change, and I do believe that I can do something through my education, “education is my weapon.” I am seeking a Master’s Degree in Human Rights because I’m hoping to help implement, promote, and protect human rights laws in Palestine. LSE’s program in Human Rights will challenge my beliefs and will give me the diverse platform I need in order to be successful in my field. I look forward to the challenge, the diversity, and the preparation for my field that an education from LSE would bring. Through studying human rights at LSE, I can perform tasks that Palestinians cannot do for themselves; I want to make a difference wherever I possibly can. I’m always willing to change the entire world for the better. Every harmed person is deserving of help, of respect and dignity. Me, as an educated person, I have a special responsibility to speak out against injustice, challenge power, and provide alternatives. I have had a large number of people such as my family, my professors, and my friends who are wonderful, and who have had an influence on my life. I would one day like to give back what they have given to me by becoming a successful person in the future. I know that this Master’s program would help me to achieve my goals and once my goals are realized I will be able to provide something meaningful to all of the people. 

What I Need
I am kindly asking you to help me pursue this Masters program at the LSE by contributing to cover some of my living expenses there. As you all know, Living in the UK – particularly London, England – is expensive compared to many places in the World.  Average student rents are approximately £150 per week, in addition to my rent, I will need approximately £104 per week for living costs. Thus, i need to raise enough money to cover the approximate cost of 10,000 USD for the entire academic year at the LSE. I would greatly appreciate your financial support in whatever amount you can contribute, Any help that you might be able to offer would be very gratefully received.

Other Ways You Can Help
Donations from friends, family, associates and the public at large will, of course, be the greatest help. Additionally, I ask each of you to become an ambassador for my campaign. Please spread the word among your own circle of friends and contacts through Facebook and other social-media channels. This will rapidly build awareness, and will truly help me reach my fundraising goal. I feel it will not be so onerous to raise $10,000 to cover all of my living expenses in London for one year.

story:
Imagine a world where you are a child and you cannot see anything in front of you, you are tortured for your disability, and you have been abandoned by your parents because you are blind and they cannot afford to take care of you.

This is the world of the children of NIBDA (Nepal Integrated Blind Development Association). Abandoned, alone, hungry, without clothes, family, basic medicine, or someone who cares if they live or die.

Imagine being a child who is blind and has to walk miles to get to the nearest public transportation to get to a doctor or to get food in a place with barely any infrastructure.


Seeing these things first hand during my time in Nepal, I wanted to create this campaign to provide the NIBDA (Nepal Integrated Blind Development Association) with a van to improve their ability to transport the 10+ blind children who live in the Blind Center along with the 300+ disabled people NIBDA supports. Transportation will provide the infrastructure necessary to benefit their quality of life, education, and attend to their medical needs.

The van costs 1 million Nepalese Rupees which is equivalent to 10,000 dollars. The cost above this is to pay for campaign fees.

Thank you so much for reading this. Please donate! Every dollar counts. Together we can make this world a better place.

story:
Teboho: Mentoring South Africa's Youth

Teboho trust supports at-risk youth (often orphans) in Soweto, South Africa -- a part of South Africa violently repressed under the old Apartheid regime. Teboho:

  • Educates these children with classes that supplement their public school education
  • Builds self-esteem among the students
  • Makes sure everyone has healthy meals
  • ...and so much more!

A New Building

Currently, we hold classes in a dilapidated school that gets intensely hot in the summer, and does not keep the freezing wind out in the winter. As you would imagine, it is difficult to teach in these conditions, though we persevere. We are planning to build a new facility.

  • All of the designs, labor, and materials for the new school will be dontated.
  • The land costs money -- about $100,000 (US dollars).
  • The community's goal is to raise half of that...
  • ...with the remaining $50,000 coming from people like you!

Your money will go directly into the building fund. Teboho Trust has no overhead (everyone is a volunteer) -- 100% of your donation (except for the fee Indiegogo takes) goes directly to helping the children of Soweto.

Your Impact

With this new building, we will expand our program to:

  • Reach another 5,000 children
  • Bring in 100 more qualified teachers from the community (who donate their time)
  • Expand our programs to include quality teaching and learning on a 21st Century platform.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate:

  • Please watch the video and spread the word.
  • If you know anyone in South Africa, encourage them to volunteer at Teboho Trust.

Thank you!!


Want to know more? Here's what our kids say:

"I wish I could go to school at Teboho Trust every day. It's the best place in the whole world!"

- Nthando Thebe, Grade 10


"Teboho Trust prepared me to realize my life-long dream of becoming a medical doctor." 

- Dr. Nthabiseng Kumalo

story:
Short Summary

Maddie’s Heart

The “Maddie’s Heart” children’s books series was a labor of love created by me, Ronnee Lipman, an educator and Sandra Barker, an Educational Psychologist. Both of us are mothers and grandmothers and have been privileged enough to watch our own children grow up to become highly motivated and productive members of society.

”Brave Heart”, a story about standing up to a bully, is the first in a series of books written and illustrated, that speaks to young children about life, which is always joyful, but sometimes unfair.  Maddie, a very special stuffed dog with a magical heart on her neck, has the ability to speak to her “best friends”. This cuddly canine teaches boys and girls about decency and fairness, and instills in them the courage to overcome their fears. Maddie is based on my real dog, a Boxer named Madison, who does have a perfectly shaped heart on her neck, and whose unconditional love has been a
source of comfort through many of life’s rough roads. 

These stories were conceived over the last few years when my family was  experiencing personal turmoil in our own lives. These challenges made us stronger as individuals and strengthened the bond as a family unit.  Maddie’s love and devotion never wavered even as we all had to adapt to the changes in our lives.

Now Maddie is nearing the end of her life and is not expected to live beyond the next few months at best. It has become imperative that Sandra and I seek the funding necessary to launch this collection of books, along with the plush Maddie dog that is the character in which these life lessons are centered.  “Maddie’s Heart” is the legacy of our most precious friend and family member. 

There are six books that comprise this anthology. Some of the topics dealt with are the loss of a loved one, the transition from a home to possibly temporary housing due to foreclosure, and dealing with a grave illness. All are written through the eyes of a child and the comfort and wisdom of Maddie, the dog with the perfect heart. 

 






 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $50,000 so that we might be able to print our books and mass produce the plush Maddie doll. We need to make this magical dog available to children, parents, and educators so that Maddie can help youngsters navigate life's sometimes rough roads. Maddie and her magical heart will instill confidence in children, our most precious commodity.

We are so appreciative for any and all donations. If you contribute $25, we will send you a thank you note from Maddie. If you contribute $50, you can expect to receive a signed picture of Maddie. As a $75 donor, you will receive a copy of "Brave Heart". For those who are generous enough to contribute $100, a signed copy of "Brave Heart" will be yours to treasure.

The Impact

"Maddie offers young children the opportunity to confront many of life's pitfalls", says Sandra Barker, Psychologist and Educational Consultant


The Maddie's Heart Book series are heartfelt stories about coping with everyday struggles confronting young children.  These situations that have had a profound affect on parents and adults also affect children who have limited understanding and means of coping with these issues.  The principal characters in these stories are confronted with everyday situations that parents may not be aware are impacting children in a negative way. The main character has turned to a soulful companion named Maddie, a Boxer with a perfectly shaped heart on her neck for solace and support.  Maddie offers young children the opportunity to confront many of life's pitfalls through consult, understanding and comfort. 

These books are an excellent resource for parents and caregivers of young children with everyday emotional issues as they are confronted with life struggles.

Parents will feel better for having these wonderfully illustrated children's books.  

These books attend to the feelings felt by every child at different times of their lives along the journey to emotional stability.

Along with a delightfully soft and cuddly little dog named Maddie, these books provide communication starting points for parents to use with young children.  This series is a wonderful resource that will raise a happier child.

Sandra Barker M.A.

Educational Psychologist

Other Ways You Can Help

For those of you who cannot contribute monetarily, we ask for your support and best wishes and hope that you will spread the word about Maddie and her magical heart.
story_txt: Short SummaryMaddie’s HeartThe “Maddie’s Heart” children’s books series was a labor of love created by me, Ronnee Lipman, an educator and Sandra Barker, an Educational Psychologist. Both of us are mothers and grandmothers and have been privileged enough to watch our own children grow up to become highly motivated and productive members of society.”Brave Heart”, a story about standing up to a bully, is the first in a series of books written and illustrated, that speaks to young children about life, which is always joyful, but sometimes unfair.  Maddie, a very special stuffed dog with a magical heart on her neck, has the ability to speak to her “best friends”. This cuddly canine teaches boys and girls about decency and fairness, and instills in them the courage to overcome their fears. Maddie is based on my real dog, a Boxer named Madison, who does have a perfectly shaped heart on her neck, and whose unconditional love has been asource of comfort through many of life’s rough roads.  These stories were conceived over the last few years when my family was  experiencing personal turmoil in our own lives. These challenges made us stronger as individuals and strengthened the bond as a family unit.  Maddie’s love and devotion never wavered even as we all had to adapt to the changes in our lives. Now Maddie is nearing the end of her life and is not expected to live beyond the next few months at best. It has become imperative that Sandra and I seek the funding necessary to launch this collection of books, along with the plush Maddie dog that is the character in which these life lessons are centered.  “Maddie’s Heart” is the legacy of our most precious friend and family member.  There are six books that comprise this anthology. Some of the topics dealt with are the loss of a loved one, the transition from a home to possibly temporary housing due to foreclosure, and dealing with a grave illness. All are written through the eyes of a child and the comfort and wisdom of Maddie, the dog with the perfect heart.     What We Need & What You GetWe are looking to raise $50,000 so that we might be able to print our books and mass produce the plush Maddie doll. We need to make this magical dog available to children, parents, and educators so that Maddie can help youngsters navigate life's sometimes rough roads. Maddie and her magical heart will instill confidence in children, our most precious commodity. We are so appreciative for any and all donations. If you contribute $25, we will send you a thank you note from Maddie. If you contribute $50, you can expect to receive a signed picture of Maddie. As a $75 donor, you will receive a copy of "Brave Heart". For those who are generous enough to contribute $100, a signed copy of "Brave Heart" will be yours to treasure.The Impact"Maddie offers young children the opportunity to confront many of life's pitfalls", says Sandra Barker, Psychologist and Educational Consultant The Maddie's Heart Book series are heartfelt stories about coping with everyday struggles confronting young children.  These situations that have had a profound affect on parents and adults also affect children who have limited understanding and means of coping with these issues.  The principal characters in these stories are confronted with everyday situations that parents may not be aware are impacting children in a negative way. The main character has turned to a soulful companion named Maddie, a Boxer with a perfectly shaped heart on her neck for solace and support.  Maddie offers young children the opportunity to confront many of life's pitfalls through consult, understanding and comfort.  These books are an excellent resource for parents and caregivers of young children with everyday emotional issues as they are confronted with life struggles.Parents will feel better for having these wonderfully illustrated children's books.   These books attend to the feelings felt by every child at different times of their lives along the journey to emotional stability.Along with a delightfully soft and cuddly little dog named Maddie, these books provide communication starting points for parents to use with young children.  This series is a wonderful resource that will raise a happier child.Sandra Barker M.A.Educational PsychologistOther Ways You Can HelpFor those of you who cannot contribute monetarily, we ask for your support and best wishes and hope that you will spread the word about Maddie and her magical heart.

story:
Dear Friends and Family,

As you hopefully have heard, I am going to be teaching 5th grade at Ridgecrest Elementary in Shoreline this year! I am absolutely thrilled. My new coworkers are supportive, fantastic people and I am excited to work with them in the upcoming months (and hopefully for years to come!). I am really looking forward to meeting my students and watching them grow over the school year.

I am starting to set up my classroom, and though the district and school provide me with the essentials for teaching, I have discovered that there are many things I would like to purchase to make my classroom a better learning environment. Things such as books for my class library, tubs to organize the books, a rug for the floor in our meeting area, computer speakers, organization for my learning stations, labels, and posters and decor to make the room more friendly. I am also hoping to eventually get a mini fridge and electric kettle, for healthy snacks and tea when I am working late or on weekends. Unfortunately, I am unable to purchase those things at this point in time, because I do not have the funds.

Would you, wonderful people, be willing to donate a few dollars to my classroom fund? Do you have any of the above-mentioned items that you want to donate to a class of grateful 5th graders (and a very grateful first-year teacher)?

story:
***New perk/package structure available***

I just changed the available perks (packages) for your convenience! Have a look at the new ones and let me know what you think...


Project Summary

These days young people are overwhelmed by having too many opportunities. Unfortunately a lot of them still don't see entrepreneurship and starting a company as a valid career path. Be it because of society that still doesn't accept entrepreneurship as something valuable or parents that want their children to have a stable income and a safe life. This is a problem that many societies face these days. A problem I am trying to fight by taking my bike and driving through Germany, my homecountry. So far, I will hold about 10 presentations at major universities where I will talk about my experiences as a founder and as 'an employee on the investor side of the startup game. 

The goal is to motivate and encourage young folks to start working on their ideas and dreams, instead of joining the hamster running wheel of the corporate world. This group of people is especially important to me, as they are our most important resource to drive innovative activities in in every country on this planet earth. Unfortunately it is also the group of people that has the least working experience and a very high failure rate. 


Sounds interesting! What are your stops? 

These are just the locations I was able to setup myself. Feel free to add some dots to the map and invite me over to speak at your university, meetup group or entrepreneurship club! I would be more than happy to meet some of you along the way. Here are the locations I will stop bye in October and beginning of November. 



Nice! But what will I get for supporting this project?

Depending on the funding size you will either get a hand-written thank you card, an early adopter certificate, the e-book or the printed version of my new book "The Perfectly Executed Startup". In the book I will talk about my experiences in the startup scene, my time as a founder in China, and what I learned while having worked in the VC scene in Germany and the United States. You will be introduced to a framework that will support you on your journey from testing your idea on the market, over building your team to getting funded. Here are the different bundles available: 


          

Other ways you can support this project

In case this sounds interesting and you want to support me in any other kind of way please don't hesitate to contact me. Anything that creates more noise will help the project and increase the noise. Also if you want me to come over and speak at your university, entrepreneurship club or meet up group, just let me know. Any support is highly appreciated!


Alright, now who is the guy behind all of this? 

In case you want to get to know me a bit better, you can check out the interview that Berlin based startup ununi.tv did with me a couple of days ago...


And here's the link to my blog "the entrepreneurial fool" where I regularly post some of my thoughts about entrepreneurship, startups and other things that keep me busy thinking.

http://yanngirard.typepad.com/


*** Updates - Read the story ***

Should you be interested in receiving updates, just follow this campaign or click the link below, where I will regularly post impressins from my tour. It already covers all the way from Cologne over Aachen to Munich. A nice and crisp read! 

http://bit.ly/GVnotj


Folks I'd love to mention

Here is a list of some great folks I would love to mention here that supported me along the way organizing this incredible roadtrip and working on my book. You guys rock!!

Main supporter: 

       


Stops & presentations at:

            

                


Featured on:

story:
Grace Rwanda is a registered Canadian charity founded in 2009 by two survivors of the Rwandan Genocide, Elizabeth Mujawamaliya Johnson and Marie Louise Kaligirwa. Their goal is to ensure Rwandan youth have a brighter future through education, specifically, through literacy and the world of books.

Rwanda has made great strides since close to a million of its citizens were slaughtered in the 1994 genocide. The government has heavily promoted education, but resources — especially in rural areas — are still scarce. According to the government's own statistics, every three primary grade students must share two books, and there is only one textbooks for every five secondary students. 

Over the past few years, Grace Rwanda has worked hard to improve those odds. The charity started by helping to build classrooms, washrooms, a kitchen and livestock program at a school in the eastern town of Rwinkwavu. In 2011, Grace Rwanda began installing mini-libraries in six schools across the country. In 2013, the team installed a community library in a youth centre in Muhanga province. 

Grace Rwanda has since met with the government and agreed to provide similar libraries in 20 other youth centres across Rwanda. At the same time, the Grace Rwanda team is working to put more mini-libraries in schools, eventually providing at least one reading book to all 87,000 students in Muhanga province. This campaign will provide primary school classes with a new library. Each $2 buys one book. 

Please help us give the gift of reading to a Rwandan child this holiday. Donations over $25 are tax deductible. Every little bit helps. If we reach our goal, we'll use additional funds to stock more libraries! If you can't donate, please consider spreading the word of our campaign on your social networks. We will update our progress on library installation on our website so you can see the difference your donation makes.

Learn more about Grace Rwanda and the work that we do at GraceRwanda.org. Follow us on Twitter @GraceRwanda. Like us on Facebook at Facebook.com/GraceRwandaSociety. Watch our videos at Youtube.com/GraceRwandaSociety. Join our circle at Google+. And check out our pictures on Flickr.
