story:
paprfloor - the most ecological flooring alternative

The idea behind paprfloor is quite simple. We looked for an alternative to the normal flooring at fair, that produces a lot of waste and costs. An we found corrugated paper that is normally used for packaging. At the Hannover Fair 2014 we installed that paprfloor for the first time at around 200sqm and it was really surprising, because the floor became more lovely with every day. And so we decided to produce the first charge of the paprfloor. For that we are now looking for investors and friends that will support this project.

Floors at trade fairs cause more than 19,000 tons of hazardous waste every year in Germany alone, because they are made of environmentally harmful substances. paprfloor tackles this problem and saves 10kg CO2 per square meter. After many years of being at trade fairs ourselves and looking for an environmentally friendly floor, but not finding one, we decided to develop one ourselves. And paprfloor is the result.


The idea of paprfloor

paprfloor is an ideal alternative for flooring, because it is

  • ecological 
  • non-allergic
  • individual
  • easy to use

The money that you will spend will be used for:

  • Building up the brand and an internet store
  • Improve the production process
  • Producing the first charge of 6000sqm
  • Research to make the floor fire-proof (B1)
  • develop a sales and partner concept

With our perks you get a sample of the floor combined with a small bit of art. And so every perk will be unique.

The consequence

paprfloor will change the flooring industry because it offers a really alternative to the exisiting products. And this alternative will not be produced with childrens hand or a lot of energy and ressource consumption. So paprfloor will be the first ethic flooring. 

paprfloor has been developed from the outset in the same way as normal floors, so that buying is as easy as possible. We were looking for regional partners who could provide us with ethically correct and recycled corrugated board. With these we developed the new floor covering and introduced it in 2014. In the meantime, we have optimised the supply chain and are also taking care of recycling the floor covering after the end of the trade fair. This avoids not only the horrendous CO2 consumption in the production and disposal of normal floor coverings, but also environmental pollution in the producing countries and possible ethical problems.

Risk and challenges

We know the production chain and the value of our product. We can not estimate the acceptance of the potential customers and so the project can be unsuccessful at the end. We are able to deliver more than the first 6000sqm in a very short timeframe but we can not be sure if we find enough partners to install and sale the paperfloor. 

The biggest challenge is the acceptance of potential users, which makes paprfloor look different and behaves differently than normal floor coverings. However, we believe that these can be neutralized by the argument of CO2 avoidance. A second risk is the increasing security conditions at trade fairs. Technically, there is a limit to producing a paper-based floor in an environmentally friendly but fire-protected way. In this respect, it can happen that a fire protection guideline prevents the use of paprfloor and thus closes the market. We assume that if paprfloor is successful, the traditional manufacturers will try to do just that. We want to counteract this by trying to establish a guideline for environmentally friendly materials at trade fairs.

Other ways to help

If you fell that paprfloor deserves your respect feel free to invite people to share the idea, to find investors or to buy the product in future. 

paprfloor - die ökologischste Alternative zu bisherigen Messeböden


Die Idee hinter paprfloor ist ganz einfach. Wir suchten auf der Messe nach einer Alternative zum normalen Bodenbelag, die viel Abfall und Kosten verursacht. Wir fanden Wellpappe, die normalerweise für Verpackungen verwendet wird und entwickelten daraus paprfloor. Auf der Hannover Messe 2014 haben wir paprfloor zum ersten Mal auf rund 200 qm verlegt und es war wirklich überraschend, dass der Boden mit jedem Tag schöner wurde. Und so entschieden wir uns, die erste Charge des Paprfloors zu produzieren. Für die weitere Entwicklung suchen wir nun Investoren und Freunde, die dieses Projekt unterstützen.

Fußböden auf Messen verursachen allein in Deutschland jährlich mehr als 19.000 Tonnen gefährliche Abfälle, weil sie aus umweltschädlichen Stoffen bestehen. paprfloor löst dieses Problem und spart 10 kg CO2 pro Quadratmeter. Wir haben verzweifelt nach einer Alternative dafür gesucht aber keine gefunden, so dass wir uns entschlossen, einen selbst zu entwickeln. Und paprfloor ist das Ergebnis.


Die Idee von paprfloor


paprfloor ist eine ideale Alternative zum herkömmlichen Bodenbelag, denn es ist:

  • ökologisch 
  • nicht allergisch
  • individuell
  • leicht zu bedienen

Ihr Investment fließt in:

  • Aufbau der Marke und eines Internetshops
  • Verbesserung des Produktionsprozesses
  • Herstellung der ersten Charge von 6000qm
  • Forschung zur Brandsicherheit des Bodens (B1)
  • Entwicklung eines Vertriebs- und Partnerkonzept

Mit unseren Perks erhalten Sie ein Muster des Bodens kombiniert mit einem kleinen Stück Kunst. Und so wird jeder Perk einzigartig sein.

Die Konsequenz


paprfloor wird die Betrachtung auf den Messefußboden verändern, weil es eine echte Alternative zu den bestehenden Produkten bietet. Und diese Alternative wird nicht mit Kinderarbeit oder mit viel Energie und Ressourcenverbrauch produziert. paprfloor wird also auch der erste ethische Bodenbelag sein. 

paprfloor wurde von Anfang an wie normale Böden entwickelt, so dass die Nutzung so einfach wie möglich ist. Wir suchten regionale Partner, die uns mit ethisch korrekter und recycelter Wellpappe versorgen konnten. Mit diesen haben wir den neuen Bodenbelag entwickelt und 2014 eingeführt. Inzwischen haben wir die Supply Chain optimiert und kümmern uns auch nach Messeschluss um das Recycling des Bodenbelags. Dies vermeidet nicht nur den horrenden CO2-Verbrauch bei der Herstellung und Entsorgung normaler Bodenbeläge, sondern auch Umweltbelastungen in den Erzeugerländern und mögliche ethische Probleme.

Risiken und Herausforderungen


Wir kennen die Produktionskette und den Wert unseres Produktes. Wir können die Akzeptanz der potentiellen Kunden noch nicht abschätzen und könnten daher unter Umstände das Projekt am Ende nicht erfolgreich abschließen. Wir sind in der Lage, mehr als die ersten 6000 qm in einem sehr kurzen Zeitrahmen zu liefern, aber wir können nicht sicher sein, ob wir genügend Partner für die Installation und den Verkauf des Papierfußbodens finden. 

Die größte Herausforderung ist die Akzeptanz potenzieller Nutzer, da paprfloor in der Nutzung anders aussieht und sich anders verhält als normale Bodenbeläge. Wir glauben jedoch, dass dieses Risiko durch das Argument der CO2-Vermeidung neutralisiert werden kann. Ein zweites Risiko sind die zunehmenden Sicherheitsauflagen auf Messen. Technisch gesehen ist eine umweltschonende Herstellung eines feuerfesten papierbasierten Fußbodens nur in Grenzen möglich. Insofern kann es vorkommen, dass eine Brandschutzrichtlinie den Einsatz von paprfloor verhindert und damit den Markt verschließt. Wir gehen davon aus, dass die traditionellen Hersteller versuchen werden, wenn Paprfloor erfolgreich ist, genau das zu tun. Dem wollen wir entgegenwirken, indem wir versuchen, auf Messen eine Richtlinie für umweltfreundliche Materialien zu erarbeiten.

Andere Möglichkeiten zu helfen


Wenn Sie glauben, dass paprfloor eine Chane verdient hat, dann laden Sie Leute ein, die Idee zu teilen, Investoren zu finden oder das Produkt in Zukunft zu kaufen.

Insofern kann es vorkommen, dass eine Brandschutzrichtlinie den Einsatz von paprfloor verhindert und damit den Markt verschließt. Wir gehen davon aus, dass die traditionellen Hersteller versuchen werden, wenn Paprfloor erfolgreich ist, genau das zu tun. Dem wollen wir entgegenwirken, indem wir versuchen, auf Messen eine Richtlinie für umweltfreundliche Materialien zu erarbeiten.Andere Möglichkeiten zu helfenWenn Sie glauben, dass paprfloor eine Chane verdient hat, dann laden Sie Leute ein, die Idee zu teilen, Investoren zu finden oder das Produkt in Zukunft zu kaufen.

story:
Seduced by the beauty of wind energy. Together with my two sons, we have started Aesthenergy making the Netherlands more beautiful and more sustainable. We are highly motivated to support property and real estate owners in the energy transition by developing and selling beautiful, sustainable energy solutions.

In this initiative, a diverse team of students have created a design of a tiny wind turbine for your property that looks nice and simultanuously generates wind energy. This eye catcher contributes to your aim going energy neutral and off the grid. Combining solar and wind energy provides generating green energy in most wheather conditions, day and night. Together with your help and feedback, we aim at developing ‘snowdrop’ and other nature-like solutions that attracts people. Simultanuously, we aim at creating more and more efficient wind energy solutions and build our knowledge base at universities providing you value for money.

In this campaign, with your contribution, we plan to build a first prototype of the snowdrop wind turbine. This eye catcher might end up on your property! With learnings from the first prototype and feedback from potential customers we further develop beautiful, tiny wind turbines for manufacturing purposes to produce larger quantities of affortable, efficient eye catchers with a high yield.

For building the first prototype, we need funding of about $10,000. On top of this, we need funding for testing the first prototype resulting in a CE certificate. 

When you have contributed the highest fund, then we make this eye catcher available for you to place and install it on the perfect spot for you. Your contribution to this crowd funding will be substrated from the total price of this snowdrop wind turbine which we expect to cost $6,000-$9,000 excluding transportation and installation costs.

In the Netherlands, more and more attention in the energy transition is paid to solar energy. Unfortunately, more and more citizans express negative perceptions towards wind energy due to the fact that wind turbines need to become larger and larger for increasing yields. This negative perception is slowing down the energy transition. The development of nice-looking, tiny wind turbines is an initiative to turn around these perceptions: wind turbines can be beautiful and efficiencies can be optimised resulting in higher and higher yields (just like PV panels in the last decade). Your support for this important development is highly needed and will help to increase the pace of the energy transition. With your funding and one or more nice-looking, tiny wind turbines on your property, you will demonstrate the importance as well as the enthousiasm for wind energy (which is a valuable energy source for centuries already).

Safety is a key property of wind turbines. When buying building blocks and creating new constructions the safety of the components as well as the total eye catcher should be non-negotiable safe. We plan to spend as much as effort as needed to make sure we bring safe wind turbines on the market. Negative properties for very large wind turbines, such as cumbersome shade and noise, are also double checked for these tiny wind turbines, with the expectations that we eliminate properties, such as shade issues, or transform these in positive ones such as silent wind turbines.

When you like our initiative of developing nice-looking, tiny wind turbines and/or the snowdrop eye catcher, please spread the word, make some noise and share this crowd funding funding request to your friends and relatives using the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
JAW Batteries are special batteries that have a special non-toxic compound within a customized AA battery body.

We've done extensive research to bring to the world the ONLY battery with the ability to stay inert until it is submerged into water to trigger it, and thus become an active, useable and portable power source!

Our research team are eager to try the technology on other applicable ideas.  IF you have a good application idea, try it, show us, lets' talk!  So far, the most practical and easily executable application are AA batteries that will survive 20+ years in storage. Non-leaking, non-corroding, instantly activated by H20.  

PERFECT for emergency situations where powerful batteries are needed for survival.

We like to know if there are other ways to use this technology (and how we can work to develop a new product together).

 

 

Are you a prepper?  READ ON!

Today's AA batteries discharge when left unused for a long time. The internal chemistry changes, and as a result, hydrogen gas is generated. This bloats the battery AND ruptures it at the very tip or the outer metal canister... or worse, both. 

Harmful chemicals like potassium hydroxide then leak from the battery.  It is a  corrosive material that is highly toxic. This caustic material can cause skin irritation and can also damage your eyes. Inhaling Potassium Hydroxide can irritate the lungs. 

If you're a first-responder or a prepper, JAW Batteries need to be in your go-bag or disaster shelter!

 

JAW Batteries are inert batteries AND are THE SAFEST AA batteries on the planet!

It doesn't corrode EVEN when stored for 20+ years and once activated by water, it's instantly charged to a full 100%.

 

ACTIVATE JAW BATTERIES IN AN EMERGENCY!

JAW Batteries stays inert, even for 20+ years, and instantly activates with water. That's why it's the perfect battery for any emergency!

Have you ever marveled at the possibility of storing energy forever? And for such energy to be unleashed by something as ubiquitous as water?

Keep a number of JAW Batteries at home, office, building, in your cars, boats, or plane... keep it handy, they're ready & vacuum-packed for use, anytime, anywhere!

 

ALL YOU NEED IS WATER!

 

✅JAW Batteries are unique. They are the only AA (1.5V) batteries in the world that is made with environment-friendly materials to store a charge. This charged material stays inert until it is triggered by water.  In layman terms, we’re putting these batteries to sleep indefinitely and you can easily wake them up with water / any liquid.

✅JAW Batteries have been tested in many types of water. We even tested it with tea, milk , soda and even urine!

✅JAW Batteries are non-toxic, non-staining and non-leaking.  Absolutely no rare-earth elements used!

✅JAW Batteries will come in the following sizes:

  • AA Batteries (done) 
  • AAA Batteries (almost ready !)
  • 9V (in final stage of safety testing)

 

Whatever emergency situation you're in, power up your emergency equipment with JAW Batteries and significantly increase your chance or survival! 

 

 

The journey has been long, yet extremely fulfilling. We are amazed at how this became a dream-come-true for the team. Just like any other great idea, it all started with a concept sketch. Even before the devastating natural disasters in 2018, our team at JAW were thinking of ways to change and innovate the portable power landscape. We thought it was impossible, and that the technology available will not support it. But we were determined... and now we’re proud to bring JAW Batteries to the world.

 

 

 

 

 

Here's a quick and simple guide that shows you how to activate and use JAW Batteries. They stay inert for more than 20 years, more than any battery that is currently out in the market. Instantly activated for use, fully charged, by water.   

 

 

JAW Batteries took 9 years to develop. From our very early humble beginnings to today, our team is just so amazed, thankful to families and friends who believed with us. This journey is worth it, because you have walked with us... hand in hand.  THANK YOU!

Generation 1 was developed Oct 2010

 

Generation 2 was developed Mar 2011

 

Generation 3 was developed Dec 2012

 

Generation 4 was developed Dec 2015

 

Generation 5 was developed Jan 2018 (AA sized)

 
 

Our experiments were conducted in controlled environments. Tests for each generation allowed us to build, improve our features through the years.  Safety was a primary concern from day 1.  JAW Batteries are made with utmost diligence and special care.

We are ready to launch! We are ready to mass-produce!  We are ready to ship JAW Batteries, worldwide.

 

 

JAW Batteries come in very handy in emergencies such as this. Be sure to carry a pair in your bag, wherever you go. It may literally save the night and your life!  

Check out these JAW Battery situations too!

 

 

 

A few pairs of JAW Batteries in the glove compartment provides reliable power for your emergency light during engine trouble at night. Your safety is important when your car breaks down in the middle of nowhere! 

 

 

 

In emergencies, a few pairs of JAW Batteries in your bug-out bag will help you survive the sudden trip to safety. It weighs just as much as regular AA batteries. Keep it in the bag for many years, use it fresh and powerful as if you just got it yesterday!

 

 

 

Your tackle box will have enough space for a few pairs of JAW Batteries. Your future fishing trips will be a very safe adventure knowing that you have compact, inert, stored power that is very reliable when you do need it!

JAW Batteries are the perfect gift for your fishing buddies!

 

 

 

Keep JAW Batteries in a kitchen drawer, the toolbox, the fusebox, the basement, attic or living room.  Keep it accessible all the time. JAW Batteries will never lose power. It stays inert until you activate it with water!

 

 

 

Camping is fun, and getting back to nature is a memorable experience, great for the heart and soul. Be sure you've packed JAW Batteries (to power your torches) just in case you approach dawn and going into the night. You need to make the trip safe for you and your companions.

 

 

 

Hiking through a nature trail brings you the solitude you seek. It's the trees, your backpack, hiking gear... and you. Remember to bring enough snack food and water to sustain you. JAW Batteries for emergencies if you pass through a dark path in the jungle, or get caught up for the night.

 

 

When it comes to most survival situations, batteries are often overlooked. We make the mistake to think that a fresh pack of unused batteries does not expire or weaken. Or that one kind of batteries performs better.  Truth is, our batteries do leak, they can't be stored for a very long time and they have poor low-temperature, some high-temperature, performance. 

In general, batteries self-discharge, they weaken in time. Used or unused. And some weaken FASTER than others. 

We need batteries that stay inert, alive and fully charged... FOR MANY MANY YEARS.

 

 

Reliable batteries spell the difference between life, survival and even death. In a powerless dark house, a car broken down the road at night, coming home from a hike, at a camp out in the middle of nowhere, your batteries are your primary source of light and power to survive the dark night.

story:
Who We Are

Growing up, our families were uniquely aware that we could lose one of our loved ones in the utility lineman industry. In fact, linemen have a 1 in 50 chance of dying on the job throughout their career. We didn't like those odds, so we created Safeguard Equipment to develop products to keep our loved ones safe. 

Fast forward to today. Puerto Rico, Florida, and the Virgin Islands were ravaged during this last hurricane season. More than 80% of the electrical grid in Puerto Rico is still non-functioning. In order to help rebuild the island's infrastructure, there has been an influx of electrical professionals working tirelessly. Unfortunately, 6 journeyman linemen have already died in this restoration effort. With your help, we can give them a sixth sense to make them aware of unseen high voltage. 

We Need Your Help

Linemen, first responders, and other disaster relief efforts are working to aid in hurricane relief, putting themselves at risk of electrocution due to down power lines, faulty transformers, and malfunctioning equipment. We want to protect them so they can continue serving others effectively. Our device, Compass, will alert these heroes before they approach dangerous high voltage. Our initial push is to provide a Compass device to all the workers in Puerto Rico, but there's a need in developing countries as well. We need your help to cover the additional manufacturing costs and product adjustments to take our product (initially developed for the utility industry) to heroes around the world. 

There is a global need for higher safety standards, and that need is readily apparent in the electrical industry. In some developing countries, 1 out of 4 linemen will die during their career simply because they weren’t given access to proper training standards. And with their limited access to protective equipment, these individuals must risk their lives simply to bring electricity to their families. When you fund our efforts to provide Compass to disaster-ravaged and developing communities, you're providing a new layer of safety - a sixth sense for dangerous voltage in the area - to trained professionals and self-taught community members alike. 

It's an innovative, life-saving device that will detect an energized source and warn a user if they are in danger of being electrocuted. It will drastically lower the chance of electrocution for anyone working around energized surfaces and conductors.

Compass™, has been applied to a helmet clip that acts as a heads-up-display for easy use and functionality. In this form factor, it brings 360-degree electrical detection, providing notifications of proximity and approximate direction of an electrically charged source. Once detected, Compass™ provides the user with both audible and visual notifications.

What We Need & How You Can Help

Let's break it down in more detail:

    •    Compass™ is production ready! Your funding in this campaign will go directly towards completing production while providing us with funds to provide Compass™ to Puerto Rico lineman. Once our goal has been met, we’ll not only continue providing aid to Puerto Rico, we’ll also work on expanding our program to other hurricane areas with heroes in need.

    •    Help us get people excited! We need your help creating awareness, and letting people know that they can provide LIFE-SAVING protection for disaster relief workers. 

    •    Share our story on social media. Even in the US, many families have loved ones who risk their lives on a daily basis to maintain our infrastructure. As our friend, Brady (Journeyman Lineman), puts it, "This device is the cries of widows and orphans. This will save lives." Please share this cause, and help save lives at home and abroad.

story: Hello, and thank you for visiting our page! We are so happy to introduce G.E.O.D and to announce that our machine is around 96% efficient. We can now make the units in very small or very large application sizes! Now that we can share with the world how G.E.O.D works we are confident we will see an outpour of support from our local and nationwide sponsors! The funding received will get us to the trade shows, build smaller more efficient units, help with advertising, purchase materials, and get the ball rolling for a greener, cleaner earth. Be sure and visit our other videos on my youtube channel  https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCf6H23XH3ogGMS...  to see how far we've come and to see some of the many emergency applications G.E.O.D has to offer. Thank you for all the love and support!

story:
Standard solar panels are great but only about 17% of the energy falling on them is usable, the rest is lost as waste heat.

Instead of wasting this energy, Roadrunner’s Solar Sandwich converts it into usable hot water.

As the water is heated it also cools the solar PV cells making them more efficient. For example; a standard 250 watt rooftop panel in summer is heated to 110 degrees Centigrade or more, reducing its power output by over half as shown in the following chart. The Solar Sandwich, while heating water to ~40 degrees Centigrade, is also cooling the photovoltaic cells to the same temperature thus increasing the power output by up to 60%.

 

 

The Solar Sandwich is a single panel with PV cells and a fluid plenum integrated together as shown in the following depiction.              

            

Solar energy impinging on the panel is first converted into electrical energy by the photovoltaic cells while the energy that would otherwise heat the pv cells is transferred to the water circulating through the plenum. This not only heats the water but also cools the pv cells, making them more efficient and thus producing more electricity.


 

The following photos show the front (PV) side of the prototype Sandwich and the back or plenum side.

A video illustrating the prototype in operation is included at the end of the presentation.

A typical home or commercial installation is shown in the following depiction.

The ideal commercial applications are hotels, motels and laundromats of which there are over 50,000 hotels and motels and 29,000 laundromats in the United States alone. Non-commercial applications would mainly be large homes or ones with pools or Jacuzzis.

 

 

In an off-grid application the electricity would be used either directly or to charge batteries for later use. Similarly, the hot water could either be used in real time or stored for later use. Typical applications are off-grid sites such as cabins or third world areas where electricity and hot water are either currently not available or are provided by diesel generators.  Smaller portable versions are ideal for boats and recreational vehicles.  

 

Green Benefits

In first six months of 2016 a new solar panel was installed every 84 seconds or about 1000 installations per day. This installation rate is projected to take the current total of 1.2 million solar panel installations to about 2.2 million by end of 2018. The amount of heat energy wasted in these installations is equal to 435 billion cubic feet of natural gas or 75 million barrels of oil per year!

If all of these used the Solar Sandwich instead of natural gas or electricity it would save almost this entire amount- 435 billion cubic feet of natural gas or 75 million barrels of oil per year!

Campaign Development Plan

So far we have completed and tested a prototype that demonstrates the concept. We are now seeking to raise $275,000 to modify the current design into one that can be manufactured cheaply and in high volume.

The design process is broken down into three phases: the fluid plenum design, the panel design that incorporates the plenum into the integrated panel and the automated assembly design for high volume manufacturing.

Plenum design- For this component we plan to contract with an existing, high volume manufacturer of thermal transfer products: an automotive radiator manufacturer for example. These companies are the best capable of designing and producing a product that can meet both our cost and performance needs.

Panel assembly and automated manufacturing design- For this we plan to contract with an existing panel manufacturer that is currently producing standard PV panels. They will have the best capability to not only produce the design but also know how to make the design compatible with high volume manufacturing. A manufacturing line split is envisioned whereby the existing line produces all the components that are in a standard PV panel and the split the line into 1) their existing product line and 2) the line that assembles our integrated panel. This will significantly reduce the capital costs for getting into production.

Management Team

Our campaign is led by our CEO Bobby Watson while the technology development is led by our CTO Ian Aeby.  Bill Towne is our CFO. Ian and I have been friends and business associates since our days at Los Alamos Scientific Labs and Bill and I have worked together on business and financing projects for over 15 years.  Collectively we have over a century of solar energy, start-up, technology development, general management, financing and investment banking experience. Our detailed biographies can be found on LinkedIn.  

Estimated Budget

The estimated budget is shown as follows:

$75,000       Project Management

$50.000          Legal, Administrative and Campaign Costs

$75,000       Thermal Plenum Design

$75,000       Integration and Automation layout

We believe this is sufficient to begin production and initiate sales. However, if our campaign does not achieve its financing goal, we plan to use the proceeds received to structure an equity securities offering to raise the additional capital required. In addition we will be pursuing other alternatives such as strategic partnerships, co-marketing and sales agreements etc. which will allow us to reach our objectives with a lower amount of capital.

Schedule

Our plan calls for a parallel design effort that will allow production to begin in early Spring 2018 with deliveries shortly thereafter.

Reporting

We will be publishing monthly progress reports on our website detailing the progress made and overall status of the project.

Impact

In 2016 over 1000 solar panels were installed each day. This is expected to grow until 20-25% of electricity in the U.S. is produced by solar panels. With the Solar Sandwich, an even larger amount of thermal energy could be produced with hot water. The energy savings and reductions in greenhouse gases are simply tremendous.

Perks

All contributors will have their name listed on our Roadrunner website. Other examples of Perks are as shown below.

 

Prototype Test Demo
story_txt:
Standard solar panels are great but only about 17% of the energy falling on them is usable, the rest is lost as waste heat.
Instead of wasting this energy, Roadrunner’s Solar Sandwich converts it into usable hot water.

As the water is heated it also cools the solar PV cells making them more efficient. For example; a standard 250 watt rooftop panel in summer is heated to 110 degrees Centigrade or more, reducing its power output by over half as shown in the following chart. The Solar Sandwich, while heating water to ~40 degrees Centigrade, is also cooling the photovoltaic cells to the same temperature thus increasing the power output by up to 60%.
  
 
The Solar Sandwich is a single panel with PV cells and a fluid plenum integrated together as shown in the following depiction.              
            
Solar energy impinging on the panel is first converted into electrical energy by the photovoltaic cells while the energy that would otherwise heat the pv cells is transferred to the water circulating through the plenum. This not only heats the water but also cools the pv cells, making them more efficient and thus producing more electricity.

 
The following photos show the front (PV) side of the prototype Sandwich and the back or plenum side.

A video illustrating the prototype in operation is included at the end of the presentation.
A typical home or commercial installation is shown in the following depiction.

The ideal commercial applications are hotels, motels and laundromats of which there are over 50,000 hotels and motels and 29,000 laundromats in the United States alone. Non-commercial applications would mainly be large homes or ones with pools or Jacuzzis.
 

 
In an off-grid application the electricity would be used either directly or to charge batteries for later use. Similarly, the hot water could either be used in real time or stored for later use. Typical applications are off-grid sites such as cabins or third world areas where electricity and hot water are either currently not available or are provided by diesel generators.  Smaller portable versions are ideal for boats and recreational vehicles.  
 


Green Benefits
In first six months of 2016 a new solar panel was installed every 84 seconds or about 1000 installations per day. This installation rate is projected to take the current total of 1.2 million solar panel installations to about 2.2 million by end of 2018. The amount of heat energy wasted in these installations is equal to 435 billion cubic feet of natural gas or 75 million barrels of oil per year!

If all of these used the Solar Sandwich instead of natural gas or electricity it would save almost this entire amount- 435 billion cubic feet of natural gas or 75 million barrels of oil per year!

These companies are the best capable of designing and producing a product that can meet both our cost and performance needs.

A manufacturing line split is envisioned whereby the existing line produces all the components that are in a standard PV panel and the split the line into 1) their existing product line and 2) the line that assembles our integrated panel. This will significantly reduce the capital costs for getting into production.

story:
What can spectrometry do for me?

Spectral data enables you to:

  • Augment lighting and check its efficiency.
  • Check the canopy density and light penetration anywhere around your plants.
  • Map the spectral data of your greenhouse using GPS and add extra lighting where it's needed.
  • Experiment with plant phenotypes and keep accurate records.

Farms and nurseries can gather data for management to study with our enterprise integration. Our infrastructure will add depth and foresight to help you make better decisions. Even if you already have an automated irrigation and lighting system in place.

Why Luciscan?

Plants use the photon energy of light as an energy source to produce molecules and trigger genetic changes. Monitoring light spectrum is vital in modern agriculture.

Subtle differences in spectrum are impossible to see with the human eye and require special equipment. Available spectrometry solutions are expensive making it impractical for most growers.

Luciscan comes in a convenient handheld Bluetooth package and works with the accompanying Android or iOS apps.

Features

  • Bluetooth LE compatible with Android and iOS.
  • Built on industry standard and openly scrutinized hardware and software.
  • Lifetime-calibrated sensing with no drift over time or temperature.
  • 12 visible channels realized by silicon interference filters: 450nm, 500nm, 550nm, 570nm, 600nm and 650nm, each with 40nm FWHM and 610nm, 680nm, 730nm, 760nm, 810nm and 860nm, each with 20nm FWHM.
  • 2000mAh lithium polymer battery (about 8 hours of use at full charge).
  • Qi charging built in.

How can I get involved?

We need your help to get the word out and Luciscan in the field. We started with a simple prototype and iterated on it until we got it right. By using the latest industry standard components to design Luciscan we can provide a great product that will scale at a fraction of the cost of the competition. With your support we will be able to pay for outsourced plastics and for a large order of circuit boards. Making it possible for us to move beyond small scale production and have stock for retail grow shops.

Who is Object Syndicate?

Our focus at Object Syndicate is Agricultural Internet of Things. We build tools to empower people. We use hardware and software to give people the right data to make decisions. With the right data and careful planning you can grow heartier and healthier plants, reduce waste, increase efficiency, and be more profitable using any agriculture methodology.

Our devices fit within the current ecosystem of products farmers and green thumbs already use. We provide APIs so advanced users have the ability to connect the data to machine learning libraries.

We have a background in agriculture from growing up in the heart of Utah's farming community.

We have over 20 years of experience in software development and hardware. We integrate traditional IT best practices with agriculture. We have a compendium of software and hardware under open source licenses on GitHub.

Klynton Jessup - CEO
John Spounias - CTO

story:
MY-Board: A natural ride for nature-conscious people.

TrashRE creates smart structural design using mycelium. We are now implementing our material, MY-Foam, into surfboards.

MY-Board is the first European MY(celium surf)Board inspired by nature and powered by waste.

But why a surfboard?

Surfboards are one of the most toxic vehicles in action sports as they are mostly made of plastics.

To make a surfboard, the shaper needs a plastic core (e.g. a "blank"), either from Polyurethane (PU) or from Polystyrene (expanded Polystyrene - EPS -, or extruded Polystyrene - XPS). After shaping the core, the shaper adds layers of reinforcement cloth and binds them together with the plastic core using some resin.

Over the years, there have been progresses made to use recycled EPS from the packaging industry, but the surfboard remains plastic based. And when it breaks, thousands of plastic particles end up in the water.

What makes MY-Board unique

To create a mycelium-grown surfboard, we are partnering with an established and progressive German brand, Riot Surfboards. Riot is creating surfboards with cutting-edge technologies.

Together, we are using TrashRE technology, MY-Foam, and Riot expertise to create MY-Board.

MY-Board is composed with a MY-Foam blank, reinforced by bio-sourced cloth and S-glass and bound together with bio-based epoxy resin. This is one of our state-of-the-art construction. We are aiming for complete substitution of any non-recyclable raw material.

Visit our website to learn more about our work and products.

Join the exclusive club of mushroom surfboards riders!

Did you know that there are less people who rode a mushroom surfboard than went to space? Pre-order your MY-Board now and become one of these pioneers !

You can choose between two designs:

  • My-Board River 5´4

This MY-Board combines the speed of a retro fish with the responsiveness of a shortboard.  Ideal for people who like to surf high line, land tricks with ease, without working hard…This board comes standard in mycelium construction with FUTURES fin system and slightly tapered halfmoon.

  • MY-Board Ocean 6´0.

This MY-Board is a unique modern performance interpretation of a classic shaped single fin surfboard. It has a reflective soul with the single fin option and turns into a beast with a quad or thruster setup. This board comes standard in mycelium construction with a 4+1 FUTURES + US box fin system and rounded pin tail.

Nature-based Technology

At TrashRE, we believe that plastic pollution is a material issue. Therefore, we have been working on a material solution to solve it.

We have developed an innovative process that turns waste into a sustainable material. We use microorganisms (e.g. mycelium, the "roots" of mushrooms) to digest waste and transform it into a foam, a MYcelium Foam (MY-Foam).

MY-Foam can replace plastic foams such as polystyrene (commonly known as styropor) or polyurethane. MY-Foam is compostable and eco-friendly.

We turn trash into treasure.

Experience yourself how mushrooms can help save the world

Our technology, MY-Foam, is based on the digestion of waste by mycelium, the "roots" of mushrooms.  We have created for you in exclusivity for Indiegogo easy to use Grow-It-Yourself Kits (GIY kits) that will allow you to try yourselves out to microbiology and experience the power of mushrooms!

You will be able to grow yourself objects out of waste tailored to your desire and needs – from holidays decorations to decorative or functional objects, furniture, protective packaging, and more – your only limit is your imagination!

We are very excited to have you try our technology!

How can you help?

You can support us in many ways – you can make a donation or purchase one of our perk or spread the word about our campaign!

MY-Board will allow us to demonstrate the efficiency of our technology and to help commercialize a sustainable alternative material to plastic foam. By supporting us, you will help fight plastic pollution and save the oceans - we provide a material solution to a material issue.

To achieve our goal, you can make a voluntary donation of your choice or choose from the perks we prepared for you:

  • You can donate to help us organise trash clean ups in various locations - parcs, forests, streets, beaches...the choice is yours!
  • You can order some Grow-It-Yourself Kits that will allow you to try out our technology and grow great objects and decorations for your home.
  • You can pre-order MY-Board today and be the first one to receive this exclusive mycelium-grown surfboard.

Together we can change the world! What comes after MY-Board?

We create products with a sustainable material that will not pollute the environment once discarded. We need your help to go to production with our prototype. Our first prototype is a surfboard.

The surfboard is only the entry product that will help us prove the competitiveness of our technology. By creating a functional product for the sport industry, we will be able to prove the efficiency of our material. This is a crucial first step towards the transformation of the industries.

Indeed, our technology goes beyond being only a material: it will require the reinventing of production lines and supply chain to enhance waste and reuse it as raw material. Our technology does not produce CO2 in its manufacturing process. It uses natural organisms to remediate harmful waste and turn it into a harmless material that is compostable. We leverage natural processes to produce goods.

This will be the main change triggered by such a campaign – consumers will tell industrials which kind of product they want to purchase, but, especially HOW they want their products to be produced.

With this project, we will be triggering the advent of the Fifth Industrial Revolution: an era that will be dedicated to sustainable technologies at all levels, where everything will be reused, and nothing wasted.

By supporting us, you will not only contribute to the creation of ethical products, but you will also accelerate the adoption of a new sustainable material while sending a message to big corporation: change comes from the bottom up, not top down.

Let’s unlock the power of mushrooms and create the industry of the future today!

Timeline

Design and prototyping are in progress. Now we need your help to bring our product to production!

The first test surfboards will be built starting January 2021. With your help, their production will be ready to begin in June 2021.

Share! Share! Share! And share some more!

Spread the word about our work!

Follow and support us on Instagram and Facebook!

Visit our website to learn more about us and our work!

Use the sharing tools of Indiegogo to bring awareness on our campaign!

story:
Welcome to Qosqomposta!

Ñañachaykuna, turachaykuna! (sisters and brothers in Quechua)

Scientists, students, and activists for climate action got together in Qosqomposta (Qosqo = Cusco in Quechua), a community-oriented project that wants to divert “waste” from landfills through the collection of foods scraps powered by bikes in Cusco, Peru.

Fig 1. Illustration modified to show a historical street in Cusco city and what the service of food scraps collecting would look like. Qosqomposta 2020.

Cusco is a city full of traditions, culture, and history. People from all over the world come to experience the mysticism and magic that Machu Picchu, one of the 7 World Wonders, has to offer. However, in our city of over 400,000 people, sustainability is not a focus, and social conflicts are rising due to the lack of appropriate waste management for our ~350 tons of solid waste produced daily. About 50% of all waste generated in homes is organic, and if managed appropriately, would not only reduce greenhouse gas emissions but also would prolong the lifetime of the local landfill.

UPDATE #6: 

Help us take our sustainability movement to the HIGH ANDES!

Qosqomposta is happy to announce that Q'eros community above 3500 m (11400 feet) up to 5000m (16400 feet) found our initiative on Zero Waste and want to join! Thanks to Whole Earth Engineering, an NGO working and supporting currently in the area, we were contacted to work together towards environmental education and the creation of a recycling program.

Q'eros community is composed of 6 little villages, all of them have been voluntarily isolated from development, city growth, or anything related to modern culture because they wanted to preserve their native language, traditions, and healthy environment. They represent one of the oldest towns from the Inca Empire, and thus the Peruvian Government recognized them as a National Cultural Heritage.

They are known as the guardians of the Andean knowledge. Among their traditional and ancestral activities are the production of organic potatoes and alpaca breeding in the most extreme environments high up in the Andes. They are also talented musicians and weavers producing the most beautiful textiles ever existed. 

Q'eros people have a hard-working lifestyle aligned with nature. They thank Pachamama (Mother Earth) and Apus (mountain spirits) with rituals for the wellbeing of the people, animals, and crops. The importance of reciprocity is key for the success of their society.

Although they are very knowledgeable about soil health and agriculture and they compost and produce their own natural amendments, they need help to tackle the word "waste" which did not exist until commerce with surrounding communities began and brought these weird packaged goods (our common food in the city).

The Qosqomposta team believes strongly in the potential of exchange, cultural exchange as means for sustainable development for everyone. We would love to learn from their techniques to take care of our soils, while we teach them how to manage their plastics, cans, papers, and non-recyclables to prevent this to be an environmental disaster in such a pristine place of the Andes.

We need your help!

Ruben, a young leader of the community has contacted us to work together on environmental education focused on waste. Bringing awareness about plastic pollution and emphasizing that they can keep their traditions with no plastic and still be part of development, a sustainable one.

We proposed to them a series of workshops to know about their local waste management, how they see their future and if there is something we can all do better knowing that plastics in the city are a huge problem (and around the world). We are going to learn their composting and organic agriculture techniques in such a remote and challenging environment (so high, dry, and cold). We want to set up containers of different recyclables so that if any material comes to the villages, they know how to dispose of it correctly. Once these containers are full, they will bring them to Cusco, where we will pay for each kilo of the materials. The best of all is the fact of teaching them that nothing is left when we see nature. All the materials that could not be composted or recycled will be put into ECO BRICKS for their own constructions. All they can earn from selling the recyclables will help towards the continuity of the project.

Two members of the team are making time to travel (5 hours in dirt routes by car), posters and educational material need to be printed, containers of recyclables are needed too. Multiple trips will be needed to reinforced educational content (at least 3). This project will be supported by itself through selling the recyclables, generating an environmental, social, and economic positive impact in the community.

We would love to collect 400$. Thanks for all the support you have given us before and all the support for this current project too. Share with friends, colleagues, and family. 

Cheers from Cusco!

Now please continue reading our story...

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

What can we do?

When we think of sustainability the focus tends to be finding better ways to reuse, reduce, and recycle. While those main tenets are very helpful, the most important “R” has been forgotten: Rot. And this is perhaps one of the most precious learnings from our ancestors: the love for Mother Earth (Pachamama), shown by our sense of duty to take care of her.

Fig 2. Bucket for home composting collection in front. Behind one example of outdoor composter that we are going to teach people to reduce their food waste.

Qosqomposta is born in response to the urgent need to save valuable organic matter from waste. We want to collect all organic materials and turn them into a rich nutrient soil booster: compost. The collection from households will be powered by bicycles as an example of a carbon-neutral initiative.  In the long term, we are sure we can achieve the carbon negative standards by not only reducing the emission of methane (a greenhouse gas) in landfills but also capturing CO2 with the new plants growing in our soils. On that front, all nutrient soil produced will go back to the clients to allow home gardening or be donated to community gardens and local farmers as an incentive to produce organic crops.

We are launching this campaign to get our starting set of tools: a bike trailer, buckets, and composting materials. We believe that this project will grow on its own, with the income translating into more tools, and hopefully, the composting wave will reach our government and show them that this is possible! Food scraps are not waste. Soils need you, soils feed you. We all can grow our food and improve our health while saving the planet!

What We Need & What You Get

We would appreciate your contribution to reach our $3,000 goal! This amount will help us start the collection of food scraps from households. We will buy a bike trailer, plastic 20-gallon buckets, and composting tools and supplies. As we want to personify what sustainability looks like, our means of transportation will be restricted to bicycles only. Additionally, our composting facility design accounts for water efficiency. We will build a 20 square meter roof to collect rain and use it for maintaining the compost pile’s moisture and temperature, a necessity in Cusco’s dry climate at above 11,000 feet in elevation. The bike-powered service will be restricted to the residential collection. Once we reach the public eye, we believe that more investors will get attracted by our business model and will expand the collection service to restaurants, schools, and other businesses. Educational media will be produced since the beginning of the project and composters, as well as, composting supplies will be sold in the following months to encourage home composting besides our pick up and drop off services. 

All help is welcome! Here all the ways you can help us:

Follow our journey on social media, share and like our content: 
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Qosqomposta
Instagram:  https://www.instagram.com/qosqomposta/

Donate money through this website. 

Donate bikes, composting tools, etc. Everything is very welcome.

Share your time and experience with us. We offer an exchange of knowledge through an online workshop with one of our experts. 

The Impact

The City of Cusco is one of the most incredible cities in South America, and one of the main tourist destinations in the world. Many flocks visit the ancient capital of the Inca empire to experience the rich cultural heritage of the area. Recognized as the archaeological capital of the Americas, and as if predestined, Cusco is an integrating city, where people of all cultures, religions, and nationalities come together and exchange experiences. All of this makes it one of the most cosmopolitan cities in the world, and yet sustainability is far from the reality for local people.

 Fig 3. Part of the Qosqomposta Team in Qoricancha (Temple of the Sun) in Cusco, Peru.

Cusco’s waste management is in crisis. Our local landfill is about to reach its maximum capacity by next year. Projects for future landfill locations are already causing social conflicts, given that any new location will have a huge negative impact on the soil, water, and quality of life in the surrounding Andean communities. Such communities are not only far from the city, making them ideal for landfills, but also, they are lacking critical infrastructure. Beyond the technical flaws in waste management, the city’s population is increasing at a dramatic rate. The population was estimated at 434,654 as of 2015, which is 300% more than in 2005 (107,840) according to the Institute of Statistics and Information (INEI). No landfill will work for more than 5 years at the current consumption rate in Cusco, considering that 0.87 kg of solid waste is produced daily per capita.

Additionally, local farming is at risk with modern techniques for faster and massive crop production that force them to use pesticides, synthetic fertilizers, and even GMOs. Organic materials account for up to 50% of total solid waste in Cusco, according to recent studies. We see a clear solution to both issues. If we start the trend of composting and sustainable food production, we will tackle both waste management and food safety problems. Local people will be encouraged to rethink how they eat, where their food comes from, and what will happen after they eat it. A natural cycle.

Connecting people with mother earth (Pachamama) is not an easy task when the modern world confuses the idea of progress with practicality. Once households have subscribed to the service, they will wait up to 5 months to receive their compost back if they want it. 5 months may sound like a long time, but it worth the wait. Decomposition through composting takes time. Natural systems regenerate with time, and that is what people need to learn too.

Qosqomposta has a lot of work to do, and you can help light this fire!

Risks & Challenges

Leave the science to us. Environmental science is a fundamental aspect of the work we all have done. We cannot only say that we care about nature, but we study natural systems. 

Consuelo, our founder, went to the US to obtain her Master of Science, where she studied the implications of climate change in the community of snakes in South America. Her expertise in climate change and interest to achieve sustainable living, pushed her to get involved in the promotion of the Sustainable Development Goals proposed by the United Nations.  We acknowledge the huge responsibility of running a company for processing organic waste, given that very few companies have tried it until now. However, we believe that the new reality created by the COVID-19 pandemic has awakened an interest in people to pursue a better and more sustainable lifestyle.

Over 10 years ago, we went knocking door to door, trying to get people involved in recycling. Even though this is still a work in progress, we believe that social media has improved the way information gets to people. Facebook and Instagram will be our major sources for marketing, as well as the “Qondor Qomposters” bike and trailer that will pick up “all that nobody wants to eat” as the Andean condor does in nature. In addition to facilitating the decomposition of organic matter, the condor has an important cultural meaning in Andean mythology, with close association to the sun deity as the ruler of the upper world. This bird is considered a symbol of power and health in many Andean cultures.

We believe we are prepared for the challenges of this project and got the innovation and creativity required to move it forward!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with family and friends. We are sure this idea is replicable in many other parts of the world. Together we can stop food waste, improve our soils, and fight climate change!
story_txt: Welcome to Qosqomposta!Ñañachaykuna, turachaykuna! (sisters and brothers in Quechua)Scientists, students, and activists for climate action got together in Qosqomposta (Qosqo = Cusco in Quechua), a community-oriented project that wants to divert “waste” from landfills through the collection of foods scraps powered by bikes in Cusco, Peru.Fig 1. Illustration modified to show a historical street in Cusco city and what the service of food scraps collecting would look like. Qosqomposta 2020.Cusco is a city full of traditions, culture, and history. People from all over the world come to experience the mysticism and magic that Machu Picchu, one of the 7 World Wonders, has to offer. However, in our city of over 400,000 people, sustainability is not a focus, and social conflicts are rising due to the lack of appropriate waste management for our ~350 tons of solid waste produced daily. About 50% of all waste generated in homes is organic, and if managed appropriately, would not only reduce greenhouse gas emissions but also would prolong the lifetime of the local landfill.UPDATE #6: Help us take our sustainability movement to the HIGH ANDES!Qosqomposta is happy to announce that Q'eros community above 3500 m (11400 feet) up to 5000m (16400 feet) found our initiative on Zero Waste and want to join! Thanks to Whole Earth Engineering, an NGO working and supporting currently in the area, we were contacted to work together towards environmental education and the creation of a recycling program.Q'eros community is composed of 6 little villages, all of them have been voluntarily isolated from development, city growth, or anything related to modern culture because they wanted to preserve their native language, traditions, and healthy environment. They represent one of the oldest towns from the Inca Empire, and thus the Peruvian Government recognized them as a National Cultural Heritage.They are known as the guardians of the Andean knowledge. Among their traditional and ancestral activities are the production of organic potatoes and alpaca breeding in the most extreme environments high up in the Andes. They are also talented musicians and weavers producing the most beautiful textiles ever existed. Q'eros people have a hard-working lifestyle aligned with nature. They thank Pachamama (Mother Earth) and Apus (mountain spirits) with rituals for the wellbeing of the people, animals, and crops. The importance of reciprocity is key for the success of their society.Although they are very knowledgeable about soil health and agriculture and they compost and produce their own natural amendments, they need help to tackle the word "waste" which did not exist until commerce with surrounding communities began and brought these weird packaged goods (our common food in the city).The Qosqomposta team believes strongly in the potential of exchange, cultural exchange as means for sustainable development for everyone. We would love to learn from their techniques to take care of our soils, while we teach them how to manage their plastics, cans, papers, and non-recyclables to prevent this to be an environmental disaster in such a pristine place of the Andes.We need your help!Ruben, a young leader of the community has contacted us to work together on environmental education focused on waste. Bringing awareness about plastic pollution and emphasizing that they can keep their traditions with no plastic and still be part of development, a sustainable one.We proposed to them a series of workshops to know about their local waste management, how they see their future and if there is something we can all do better knowing that plastics in the city are a huge problem (and around the world). We are going to learn their composting and organic agriculture techniques in such a remote and challenging environment (so high, dry, and cold). We want to set up containers of different recyclables so that if any material comes to the villages, they know how to dispose of it correctly. Once these containers are full, they will bring them to Cusco, where we will pay for each kilo of the materials. The best of all is the fact of teaching them that nothing is left when we see nature. All the materials that could not be composted or recycled will be put into ECO BRICKS for their own constructions. All they can earn from selling the recyclables will help towards the continuity of the project.Two members of the team are making time to travel (5 hours in dirt routes by car), posters and educational material need to be printed, containers of recyclables are needed too. Multiple trips will be needed to reinforced educational content (at least 3). This project will be supported by itself through selling the recyclables, generating an environmental, social, and economic positive impact in the community.We would love to collect 400$. Thanks for all the support you have given us before and all the support for this current project too. Share with friends, colleagues, and family. Cheers from Cusco!Now please continue reading our story...-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------What can we do?When we think of sustainability the focus tends to be finding better ways to reuse, reduce, and recycle. While those main tenets are very helpful, the most important “R” has been forgotten: Rot. And this is perhaps one of the most precious learnings from our ancestors: the love for Mother Earth (Pachamama), shown by our sense of duty to take care of her.Fig 2. Bucket for home composting collection in front. Behind one example of outdoor composter that we are going to teach people to reduce their food waste.Qosqomposta is born in response to the urgent need to save valuable organic matter from waste. We want to collect all organic materials and turn them into a rich nutrient soil booster: compost. The collection from households will be powered by bicycles as an example of a carbon-neutral initiative.  In the long term, we are sure we can achieve the carbon negative standards by not only reducing the emission of methane (a greenhouse gas) in landfills but also capturing CO2 with the new plants growing in our soils. On that front, all nutrient soil produced will go back to the clients to allow home gardening or be donated to community gardens and local farmers as an incentive to produce organic crops.We are launching this campaign to get our starting set of tools: a bike trailer, buckets, and composting materials. We believe that this project will grow on its own, with the income translating into more tools, and hopefully, the composting wave will reach our government and show them that this is possible! Food scraps are not waste. Soils need you, soils feed you. We all can grow our food and improve our health while saving the planet!What We Need & What You GetWe would appreciate your contribution to reach our $3,000 goal! This amount will help us start the collection of food scraps from households. We will buy a bike trailer, plastic 20-gallon buckets, and composting tools and supplies. As we want to personify what sustainability looks like, our means of transportation will be restricted to bicycles only. Additionally, our composting facility design accounts for water efficiency. We will build a 20 square meter roof to collect rain and use it for maintaining the compost pile’s moisture and temperature, a necessity in Cusco’s dry climate at above 11,000 feet in elevation. The bike-powered service will be restricted to the residential collection. Once we reach the public eye, we believe that more investors will get attracted by our business model and will expand the collection service to restaurants, schools, and other businesses. Educational media will be produced since the beginning of the project and composters, as well as, composting supplies will be sold in the following months to encourage home composting besides our pick up and drop off services. All help is welcome! story:
We exist to help the change agents do good. 

There are several brands that are currently doing more to change the way business is done. They are more transparent, care about the environment, animal welfare, want to help end hunger and poverty, make education accessible to all, and overall just care about more than their own bottom line. We happen to partner with a few of them. 

We exist to help these brands spread their message and stand out amongst a sea of brands. We want to connect socially conscious consumers to socially conscious brands.

We want people to make ethical shopping decisions so that every dollar spent is a dollar that helps out a fellow person or the planet.

That's why we created Miigle+.

Do you care about the brands you shop from?

We do. We want to make sure the brands we shop from are created ethically, help those in need and make our planet a safer and cleaner place. If you feel the same, then Miigle+ is for you. Check out our video to learn more...

 

Are you a social good brand trying to make a difference in the world?

We applaud you for your efforts and want to support you so you can amplify your message and your impact. Check out our video to see how we can help...

 

How Does it Work?

We have created a browser extension that recommends socially conscious brands based on your browsing activity and products you shop online. On the extension, you can look through products, learn more about the brands' social or environmental impact, suggest your own favorite brands and products to be added to the platform, share your activity with your friends via social media, and clickthrough to a brand's product page to purchase a product. And the best part is, you can do all of this without leaving your current browser page!

Check out this video to see the browser extension in action! Better yet, visit www.miigle.com to install the browser extension and start enjoying it today!

 

How It All Began...

In 2003, Luc was 1 of 6 pre-med and medical school students selected nationally by the University of Maryland School of Medicine to assist in a Research Program that developed the world’s first anti-malaria vaccine in partnership with the University of Mali, World Health Organization and the National Institute of Health. Luc spent 2 months traveling in rural Mali, conducting research and educating villagers on how to fight against the malaria epidemic.

This humbling experience would plant the seed of Luc’s ambition to build a company that not only helps make the world a better place but also empowers others to do the same.

10 years later the idea of Miigle was born.

Our Corporate Social Responsibility

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to make our collective dreams a reality - to bring our technology to every smartphone so anyone can easily make conscious shopping decisions everyday.

We are looking for funds to help us finish the buildout and create a mobile version of our already launched browser extension.  

Any donation amount can help - a donation to us isn't just about money but also an act of kindness such as sharing this campaign or sending us words of encouragement - we welcome it ALL!

We are also going to use a portion of the funds raised to help with our marketing efforts to promote the app, in turn helping promote all of the brands we partner with.

 

Our Timeline 

Below is our project history and estimated future timeline:

As an additional Thank you....

We will plant a tree in honor of every donation received that is of $50 or more.

For this, we will be partnering with One Tree Planted, a partner in the 1% for the Planet network.

 

What if we don't raise $30K?

That's a fair question. We have chosen a flexible plan because we want to use the funds we do receive to improve our products and help our partners spread their message. So to that extent, we promise to put the dollars received to first fulfilling our donation promises noted in our perks and paying for the marketing of our social good brands. All remaining dollars will go to the build out costs of our mobile app.

And our promise to you is that we will keep you posted on how we are doing as the campaign continues and even after about how every dollar you donate is spent.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute and we get that. But that doesn't mean we can't use your help!

Help us spread the word by telling your friends, family and anyone you know about us!

Know of a really great socially conscious brand that needs some love? Send it our way so we can continue to grow our network of socially conscious brands and help make the world a better place!

Follow us on Twitter and Instagram at @miiglers // Visit our Facebook page www.facebook.com/miiglers 


Get to Know Our Team

We believe that solving big problems requires both great and diverse minds. Sure, we collectively share decades of experience but deep inside we’re really just hungry and foolish.

So here we are and rather than fancy titles we thought we'd share causes each one of us care about.

If this project sounds like something you'd like to get involved in then feel free to contact us at hello@miigle.com.

 

Why Indiegogo?


Deciding to crowdfund part of the Miigle+ project was not a decision we took lightly. Building a passionate community around our mission to “help the world consume better” is just as important to us as successfully meeting our funding goals. Not everyone can always afford to give $10, $5 or even $1 to a project they care about and we don’t believe those people should be left out from helping bring great ideas to life.

We chose Indiegogo because of the strong sense of inclusiveness and community that can be felt throughout the platform. Indiegogo to us is not just about money, it’s about bringing people together and rallying them around a common goal, regardless of the type of contribution they make.

This is a philosophy we wholeheartedly embrace and foster as a company.

Thank you.

Indiegogo to us is not just about money, it’s about bringing people together and rallying them around a common goal, regardless of the type of contribution they make.This is a philosophy we wholeheartedly embrace and foster as a company.Thank you.

story:
Work from anywhere, anytime!

Small hanging wind turbines that run or charge
any type of battery or device.

 

 

Notice:  Some details are subject to change as we finalize and improve the design.

 

 

 

Preliminary results of a 16" 3D-printed prototype:

  • In 10 mph winds, the Revolt will produce ~1 watt
  • In 15 mph winds, the Revolt will produce ~2.2 watts
  • In 10-15 mph winds, the Revolt can charge 4 smartphones at once.
  • The 4 on-board batteries hold enough power to charge 2 smartphones.
  • The batteries begin charging in a 6 mph wind.

The Revolt performs equally well in rain, sleet, and snow.  However, most rechargeable batteries do not!  Rechargeable batteries should not be used or stored in temperatures below 32⁰ F or above 90⁰ F.

Anticipated results:

The alternator is currently being redesigned and optimized specifically for the Revolt.  We anticipate doubling the power with the new design.

See the Revolt Wind turbine & legacy prototypes in action at our YouTube channel.  Stay tuned!  More test results and videos are coming!

Questions?  Please see our FAQs page and visit RevoltWind.com for additional information.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • WEBSITE: RevoltWind.com
  • TWITTER:  @RevoltWind
  • FACEBOOK:  facebook.com/RevoltWind
  • YOUTUBE: RevoltWind

 

Featured in:
